topic: Deep dive: _uuid standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _uuid standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: _uuid Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth analysis of the _uuid standard library module in Python 3.12+, highlighting its key features, uses, and enhancements.
key_points: Enhancements to version 4 UUIDs for better interoperability.
Improved performance due to new hash functions.
A new function for generating time-based UUIDs.
Support for custom variants and namespace identifiers.

code_examples.code:
import _uuid

# Generate a random UUID
uuid4 = _uuid.uuid4()
print(uuid4)

# Generate a time-based UUID
time_uuid = _uuid.uuid1()
print(time_uuid)

import _uuid

# Create a namespace instance for a custom variant
nspace4 = _uuid.UUID('2257A563-CF89-11DX-ADB7-00C04FB951ED')
print(ns4)

# Generate a UUID using the custom namespace
uuid_ns4 = _uuid.uuid4(namespace=ns4)
print(uuid_ns4)

caveats: Not all operating systems and environments support the new hash functions.
Custom namespaces may not be universally compatible across different systems.
